info.title: Pitney Bowes Data Validation
info.description: Pitney Bowes Data Validation Services helps eliminate errors in data and improve customer experience. It makes communication easier, faster and effortless by enriching customer details, keeping it up-to-date and maintaining its accuracy and consistency. To learn more, visit the documentation page: https://aka.ms/kvz9oh

post.description: ValidateMailingAddress analyses and compares the input addresses against the known address databases around the world to output a standardized detail. Learn more in our documentation: https://aka.ms/wzsawb

OutputCasing.description: Specify the casing of the output data.

PostalCode.description: The postal code for the address.

AddressLine1.description: The first line of the validated address.

AddressLine2.description: The second line of the validated address.

FirmName.description: The validated firm or company name.

PostalCode.description: The validated ZIP Code™ or postal code.

StateProvince.description: The validated state or province abbreviation.

BlockAddress.description: The formatted address, as it would appear on a physical mail piece.

AdditionalInputData.description: Input data not used by the address validation process.

PostalCodeAddOn.description: The 4-digit add-on part of the ZIP Code™.

Status.description: Reports the success or failure of the match attempt.

StatusCode.description: Reason for failure, if there is one.

StatusDescription.description: Description of the problem, if there is one.

tags: Identify API Validate Mailing Address Pro Service
post.description: ValidateMailingAddressPro builds upon the ValidateMailingAddress service by using additional address databases so it can provide enhanced detail. Learn more in our documentation: https://aka.ms/pbv0v9

OutputAddressBlocks.description: Specifies whether to return a formatted version of the address as it would be printed on a physical mail piece.

KeepMultimatch.description: Specifies whether to return multiple address for those input addresses that have more than one possible match.

OutputCountryFormat.description: Specifies the format to use for the country name returned in the Country output field.

OutputScript.description: Specifies the alphabet or script in which the output should be returned.

OutputCasing.description: Specify the casing of the output data.

MaximumResults.description: A number between 1 and 10 that indicates the maximum number of addresses to return.

PostalCode.description: The postal code for the address.

AddressLine1.description: The first line of the validated address.

AddressLine2.description: The second line of the validated address.

FirmName.description: The validated firm or company name.

ChangeScore.description: A value of 0 and 100 that reflects how much the address has changed to make it valid.

Locality.description: Generally a locality is a village in rural areas or it may be a suburb in urban areas.

AddressType.description: A single letter code that indicates the type of address.

Deliverability.description: An estimate of confidence that an item mailed or shipped to this address would be successfully delivered.

AddressQuality.description: A two character code indicating overall quality of the resulting address.

CouldNotValidate.description: Mentions the address component that could not be validated, in case no match is found.

PostalCode.description: The validated ZIP Code™ or postal code.

Country.description: The country in the format determined by what you selected.

StateProvince.description: The validated state or province abbreviation.

BlockAddress.description: The formatted address, as it would appear on a physical mail piece.

AdditionalInputData.description: Input data that could not be matched to a particular address component.

PostalCodeAddOn.description: The 4-digit add-on part of the ZIP Code™.

Status.description: Reports the success or failure of the match attempt.

StatusCode.description: Reason for failure, if there is one.

StatusDescription.description: Description of the problem, if there is one.

tags: Identify API Validate Mailing Address Premium Service
post.description: ValidateMailing AddressPremium expands on the ValidateMailingAddressPro service by adding premium address data sources to get the best address validation result possible. Learn more in our documentation: https://aka.ms/s9jl1k

OutputAddressBlocks.description: Specifies whether to return a formatted version of the address as it would be printed on a physical mail piece.

KeepMultimatch.description: Specifies whether to return multiple address for those input addresses that have more than one possible match.

OutputCountryFormat.description: Specifies the format to use for the country name returned in the Country output field.

OutputRecordType.description: Specifies the type of output record you get.

OutputFieldLevelReturnCodes.description: Specifies whether to include field-level result indicators.

OutputScript.description: Specifies the alphabet or script in which the output should be returned.

OutputCasing.description: Specify the casing of the output data.

MaximumResults.description: A number between 1 and 10 that indicates the maximum number of addresses to return.

PostalCode.description: The postal code for the address.

Status.description: Reports the success or failure of the match attempt.

StatusCode.description: Reason for failure, if there is one.

StatusDescription.description: Description of the problem, if there is one.

Confidence.description: The level of confidence assigned to the address being returned.

MultipleMatches.description: Indicates which address component had multiple matches.

CouldNotValidate.description: Mentions the address component that could not be validated, in case no match is found.

CountryLevel.description: The category of address matching available.

AddressFormat.description: The type of address data being returned.

AddressLine1.description: The first line of the validated address.

AddressLine2.description: The second line of the validated address.

AddressLine3.description: The third line of the validated address.

AddressLine4.description: The fourth line of the validated address.

StateProvince.description: The validated state or province abbreviation.

PostalCode.description: The validated ZIP Code™ or postal code.

PostalCodeAddOn.description: The 4-digit add-on part of the ZIP Code™.

Country.description: The country in the format determined by what you selected.

AdditionalInputData.description: Input data that could not be matched to a particular address component.

FirmName.description: The validated firm or company name.

ApartmentLabel.description: Apartment designator (such as STE or APT).

ApartmentLabelInput.description: Apartment designator (such as STE or APT).

CountryInput.description: Country. Format is determined by what you selected in OutputCountryFormat.

FirmNameInput.description: The validated firm or company name.

HouseNumberResult.description: The field-level result indicator for HouseNumber.

LeadingDirectionalResult.description: The field-level result indicator for LeadingDirectional.

StreetResult.description: The field-level result indicator for Street.

StreetNameResult.description: The field-level result indicator for StreetName.

StreetNameAliasType.description: The field-level result indicator for StreetName Alias.

StreetSuffixResult.description: The field-level result indicator for StreetSuffix.

TrailingDirectionalResult.description: The field-level result indicator for TrailingDirectional.

ApartmentLabelResult.description: The field-level result indicator for ApartmentLabel.

ApartmentNumberResult.description: The field-level result indicator for ApartmentNumber.

ApartmentLabel2Result.description: The field-level result indicator for ApartmentLabel2.

ApartmentNumber2Result.description: The field-level result indicator for ApartmentNumber2.

RRHCResult.description: The field-level result indicator for RRHC.

RRHCType.description: The field-level result indicator for RRHC Type.

POBoxResult.description: The field-level result indicator for POBox.

CityResult.description: The field-level result indicator for City.

StateProvinceResult.description: The field-level result indicator for StateProvince.

PostalCodeResult.description: The field-level result indicator for PostalCode.

PostalCodeCityResult.description: The field-level result indicator for PostalCodeCity.

AddressRecordResult.description: The field-level result indicator for AddressRecord.

PostalCodeSource.description: The field-level result indicator for PostalCode Source.

PostalCodeType.description: Indicates the type of postal code returned.

CountryResult.description: The validated firm or company name.

FirmNameResult.description: Indicates if the firm name got validated.

StreetNamePreferredAliasResult.description: Indicates the result of preferred alias processing.

StreetNameAbbreviatedAliasResult.description: Indicates the result of abbreviated alias processing.

AddressLine5.description: The fifth line of the validated address.

AddressQuality.description: A two character code indicating overall quality of the resulting address.

Deliverability.description: An estimate of confidence that an item mailed or shipped to this address would be successfully delivered.

AddressType.description: A single letter code that indicates the type of address.

Locality.description: A locality is a village in rural areas or it may be a suburb in urban areas.

ChangeScore.description: A value of 0 and 100 that reflects how much the address has changed to make it valid.

Suburb.description: The validated firm or company name.

BlockAddress.description: It is the formatted address, as it would appear on a physical mail piece.

Latitude.description: Seven-digit number in degrees, calculated to four decimal places.

Longitude.description: Seven-digit number in degrees, calculated to four decimal places.

post.description: The ValidateEmailAddress service takes an email address and determines if it is valid. It can fix common typos to return a valid email address. It also identifies problematic email addresses. Learn more in our documentation: https://aka.ms/Yqv7pc

bogus.description: Specifies whether to check if the email address is fictitious. Default value is true.

complain.description: Specifies whether to check if the owner of the email address is known to submit spam complaints. Default value is true.

disposable.description: Specifies whether to check if the email address originates from a website that provides temporary email addresses. Default value is true.

atc.description: One character code controlling the advanced suggestion behavior. Default value is aggressive.

emailAddress.description: The email address you want to validate.

emps.description: Specifies whether to check if the email address appears on the Direct Marketing Association's 'Do Not Email' list. Default value is true.

fccwireless.description: Specifies whether to check if the email address is associated with a domain that has restrictions on commercial email per the FCC. Default value is true.

language.description: Specifies whether to check if the email address handle contains derogatory words. Default value is true.

role.description: Specifies whether to check if the email address has a non-personal handle, such as info@, sales@, or webmaster@. Default value is true.

rtc.description: Enables or disables real-time confirmation. Default value is true.

rtc_timeout.description: Specifies the timeout for real-time confirmation. Default value is 1200.

COMMENT.description: The comment string pertaining to the result of the submitted email address.

COMMENT_CODE.description: A short code which maps to each returned COMMENT field value.

EMAIL.description: The email address submitted for verification.

ERROR.description: Field reserved for special features only.

ERROR_RESPONSE.description: Pre-formatted response intended to be provided to user.

FINDING.description: One character code indicating the validity of the submitted email address.

SUGG_COMMENT.description: This field contains 'suggestion not SafeToDeliver' when ValidateEmailAddress corrected the address and the corrected version of the email address failed one or more SafeToDeliver process checks.

SUGG_EMAIL.description: Suggested correction for submitted email address, if found. A suggestion will only be provided if it is valid and SafeToDeliver.
